clinical_study.brief_title: Single-cycle Remote Ischemic Preconditioning and Postconditioning (SCRIP) Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Single-cycle Remote Ischemic Preconditioning and Postconditioning on Myocardial Injury in Patients Undergoing Emergency and Elective Percutaneous Intervention in Phramongkutklao Hospital and Thammasat University

lead_sponsor.agency: Phramongkutklao College of Medicine and Hospital

clinical_study.source: Phramongkutklao College of Medicine and Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: This trial is a 2 x 2 factorial design, double-blinded, randomized controlled trial to evaluate efficacy and safety of remote ischemic preconditioning and postconditioning in patient undergoing coronary angioplasty.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in cardiac Troponin-T from baseline

secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of myocardial injury defined as > 5 times elevation of cardiac troponin from baseline in patients with normal baseline troponin and elevation of cardiac troponin > 20% in patients who have elevated baseline troponin (>99 percentile upper reference limit).

secondary_outcome.measure: Major adverse cardiovascular events (MACE) in each intervention group
secondary_outcome.description: MACE = composite of CV death, MI, stroke, repeat revascularization, hospitalization for heart failure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of myocardial injury in differrent subgroups of patient characteristics
secondary_outcome.description: Patient characteristics include sex, age, underlying disease, medications, indication for PCI (ACS and elective PCI), baseline cardiac enzyme and creatinine. intervention.description: Preconditioning 200 mmHg x 5 minutes before procedure
Sham 10 mmHg x 5 minutes before procedure
Postconditioning 200 mmHg x 5 minutes after procedure
Sham 10 mmHg x 5 minutes after procedure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Eligible for percutaneous coronary intervention (elective and emergency cases)
- Age > 18-year-old
- Informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous CABG
- Previous PCI in 1 week / treatment with thrombolysis within 30 days
- Peripheral arterial disease / A-V shunt of upper extremities (AVF for hemodialysis)
- Paresis of upper limb
- Unstable patient such as cardiogenic shock / vasopressor / IABP / cooling (hypothermia)
- Fatal cardiac arrhythmia (VT / VF)
- Chronic hypoxia
